ygData.subject: Re: What's wrong with you people?
ygData.msgSnippet: You have an extremely good point, my friend...... I m in no hurry...although, at times...as my friends level so far above me that it is no longer desirable to
ygData.messageBody:
You have an extremely good point, my friend......

I'm in no hurry...although, at times...as my friends level so far
above me that it is no longer desirable to group....that I long to 'catch
up'....thus...I have to find new 'friends' to group with...which, btw, has
not been a problem. I still chat and trade with my higher-level
friends...and I suspect at one point, the difference in levels will be less
of a consequence...as the penalty decreases (as far as exp splitting).

Fistlebane




From: "DeGirolami, Franck" <degirolami@...> on 05/20/99 11:02
AM PDT
To: "Eqenchanters (E-mail)"
<eqenchanters@onelist.com>@SMTP@Exchange
cc:
Subject: [eqenchanters] What's wrong with you people?

From: "DeGirolami, Franck" <degirolami@...>

I had a level 16 dark elf necro that I started on the first day of
the
release. It took me 4 'played' days and a half to get it to level
16. then I
gave it up. I have now a level 16 enchanter. It took me 12 'played'
days to
make it to 16... You think that's a problem for me? I had so much
more fun
playing an enchanter. What's the deal with this level race?
Sometimes I'll
spend an hour travelling back and forth just to say hi to a friend I
havent
seen for a long time. Right now, I'm hunting in CrushBone and I
barely make
any xp where I could be soloing in Lavastorm and make a shit load of
xp and
money..but what's the big deal? I enjoy playing Everquest a lot more
now.
Powergaming is so boring. So are those people who start a race
everytime a
new server comes up.

my 2 cents,
Skara
